system.description: Almost as shady as the Assassin, a Thief is a bit more socially oriented and has a much greater care for her own life. Thieves are the flip side of the Samurai and tend to follow laws and tell the truth only if it serves their purpose. Always trying to make a profit, thieves are the businessmen of the world and will cheat you without blinking an eyelash, that is their job. If you are playing a thief, lie and make up stories, be ever watchful for a chance to search or loot and look for the profit angle, never doing anything for free.

overview.base: Choose a standard ability as you use Disruption Ball. You must choose the same ability each time you use it, unless at least 10 minutes has passed since the last time you used Disruption Ball.

results.hit: Target becomes incapable of the chosen standard ability.

overview.base:
You gain a benefit that you can expend in one of following ways of your choosing.
Attack Combo
The next attack you make is AV0.
Check Combo
The next time you Attempt Check you do so with advantage.
You may only choose one benefit per use of Combo.
overview.proficient:
The list of possible benefits you can choose from is expanded to include the following.
Block Combo
The next block you make may be done with 2 items instead of 1. You add the BV for both.
Condition Combo
Instead of rolling [[/roll 2d4]] to end some effect, you may roll either [[/roll 1d4]] or [[/roll 3d4]] (you choose). The effect ends if any of the dice roll a 4.
Feat Combo
The next time you make a feat save, you do so with advantage.
Resistance Combo
The next time you make a resistance save, you do so with advantage.

system.trigger: You use an active ability that takes at least one action.

overview.base: The ability fizzles against you. You may use Discard even if there's something in your hand.

system.requirements: You must be holding at least one item in your hand.
system.trigger: You would take damage from an ability.

overview.base: You and items you're bearing resist being stolen or unglued. All items that you bear that are glued to you, travel with you when you're wisping.
Target becomes hidden. As you hide them, you may roll [[/roll 1d20 + @snk]]. You may choose to use this as their hidden DC.
overview.proficient: Instead roll [[/roll 1d20 + @snk + @p]] for their hidden DC.
overview.fluent: Instead roll [[/roll 1d20 + @snk + @f]] for their hidden DC.

system.endCondition: Target moves or is no longer in a location with shadows, dim light, or three-quarters cover.
system.requirements: Target is in a location with shadows, dim light, or three-quarters cover.

overview.base: Whenever you hit another creature with Disarm, they are also moved 10 feet away from you. If it was a critical hit, they are instead moved 20 feet away from you.
